TopicTitle: [AAR] The Grand Tour - Voyage To The Planets

No one expects the Czokltemuss. His chief weapon is Suspense. Suspence and exitement. His two weapons are... Oh I could go on all day like this!

Edited February 14, 2014 by czokletmuss

Have fun!

As much as the atmosphere allows at least.

As much as the atmosphere allows at least.

Yup. After all:

In the Grim Darkness of the Crumbling Europe, there is only War.

It is the 1st millennium since the coming of Christ. For more than a thousand years the Roman Empire has stood, ruled from Constantinople. The Basileus is the Lord of innumerable lands by the Will of God and the might of his inexhaustible armies.

Mighty fleets cross the wide seas and vast armies give battle in his name on far lands. Greatest among his soldiers are the Imperial Tagmata, professional soldiers trained for war. Their comrades in arms are legion: levies and conscripts from the Themata, and the Brotherhood of the Sepulchre to name only a few. But for all their multitudes, they are barely enough to defend the Empire from heretics, heathens and invaders.

To live in these times is to be one amongst millions, it is to live in a collapsing, warring continent. These are the tales of these times. Forget the promise of progress and understanding for much is forgotten, never to be relearned. There is no peace amongst Men, only an eternity of carnage and slaughter, and the laughter of heathen gods.

But hey, it wasn't me - the game played itself that way. I only adjusted the narrative to fit the grimdark mood

He was referring to the Icarus.

Well, hurrah and huzzah!

I've been waiting on that one for a fair bit.

But hey, it wasn't me - the game played itself that way. I only adjusted the narrative to fit the grimdark mood

I was surprised to find something with more grimdark than the Grand Tour here. Well done with the CK2 one, I like how in character you get there. Reads like a really good history book (and not a boring textbook).

Well, hurrah and huzzah!

I've been waiting on that one for a fair bit.

Yeah, it took some time between the updates - I'm glad it's released too.

I was surprised to find something with more grimdark than the Grand Tour here. Well done with the CK2 one, I like how in character you get there. Reads like a really good history book (and not a boring textbook).

History is the most intersting story there is IMHO Thank you very much and hey, in GT we're dealing with one mission whether in CK2 we're dealing with titanic struggle across the whole Europe. It's only natural that levels of grimdark are off the charts. Plus "This Is Madnes" has this unique flavor thanks to the vast amounts of HERESY!

BTW if anyone is interested - there is -75% sale on GMG for Crusader Kings II right now. But check whether you will get Steam keys!
